intro: Ainsliaea morrisonicola, commonly known as the Morrison's ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes approximately 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, butterfly-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, although it is relatively rare in cultivation.
